Panorama¶

The Panorama property holds the panorama created from the point cloud, depending on a property (ColorProperty.ColorProperty, CurvatureProperty.CurvatureProperty, etc.). These are created based on SphericalCoordinates.SphericalCoordinates class).

Panorama Property¶

class PanoramaProperty.PanoramaProperty(sphericalCoordinates, rowIndexes=None, columnIndexes=None, panoramaData=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A panoramic representation of the point set.

Note

For the Scanstation C10 the measurements’ angular resolution for both elevation and azimuth directions:

  • Low: :math: 0.2^circ

  • Medium: :math: 0.11^circ

  • High: :math: 0.057^circ

  • Highest: :math: 0.028^circ

Attributes

Methods

The data as panorama image

The image panorama shape

property azimuth_spacing¶

Azimuth angle resolution size

property column_indexes¶

The column index of each point

Elevation angle resolution size

extract_area(left_top_corner, right_bottom_corner)[source]¶

Create a new panorama according to a bounding box

Parameters

  • left_top_corner (tuple) – (row, column) of the left top corner of the extracted area

  • right_bottom_corner (tuple) – (row, column) of the right bottom corner of the extracted area

Returns

a pointsubset according to the bounding box

PointSubSet

Get a specific characteristic value of the property

Returns

value for each point

Return type

np.array

Warning

This function needs to be overwritten for each inheriting property. It is empty at the BaseProperty

Panorama Factory¶

class PanoramaFactory.PanoramaFactory[source]¶

Creates a panoramic view from point set based on a certain property (e.g. range, intesity, etc.) The panoramic view is stored as a PanoramaProperty object

Methods

classmethod CreatePanorama_byPoints(points, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057, intensity=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a PanoramaProperty object from a point set based on according to range or intensity

Parameters

  • points (PointSet) – The point set to create the panorama from can be either a PointSet, PointSubSet or BaseProperty-derived objects

  • azimuthSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the azimuth direction (scan property)

  • elevationSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the elevation direction

  • intensity (bool) – if the pixel’s value should be the intensity value.

  • voidData – the value for NoData. Default: 250 (meters)

  • void_as_mean (bool) – flag to determine the void value as the mean value of the ranges

Returns

panorama_property

Return type

PanoramaProperty

classmethod CreatePanorama_byProperty(pointSet_property, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057, intensity=False, property_array=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates panorama with the property as the values of the pixels.

Parameters

  • pointSet_property (BaseProperty) – any PointSet property according to which the pixel’s value should be

  • azimuthSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the azimuth direction (scan property)

  • elevationSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the elevation direction

  • property_array (numpy.array) – if the values of the property to present cannot be retrieved by a simple getValues()

  • intensity – if the pixel’s value should be the intensity value.

  • voidData (float) – the number to set where there is no data

  • void_as_mean (bool) – flag to determine the void value as the mean value of the ranges

PanoramaFactory.CreatePanorama_byProperty(curvatureProperty, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057,
                      intensity=False, property_array=curvatureProperty.k1)
Returns

panorama_property

Return type

PanoramaProperty
